intro: Lepidium villarsii, commonly known as the Andean cress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as broccoli and cabbage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils. It produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately divided leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Lepidium villarsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
